subject: RE: [junit] boilerplate for testEquals, testCompareTo, testHashCo	 de wanted
msgSnippet: Probably should be more along the lines of... if (x.equals(y)) { assert x.hashcode() == y.hashcode() } A similar argument could be made for classes

Probably should be more along the lines of...

 if (x.equals(y))
 {
    assert x.hashcode() == y.hashcode()
 }

 A similar argument could be made for classes implementing
 'Comparable' 
  
 ie If x and y are Comparable

    if (x.equals(y))
    {
       assert x.compareTo(y) == 0
    }

  etc.

Jem..

> From: ccbarham [mailto:cbarham@...]
...

> 
> I believe that ideally these 'standard' tests would prove, (for any
> object named x y and z):
> equals():
> 1.  x.equals(x) returns true
> 2.  x.equals(y) returns true if y.equals(x)
> ...

For which values of x and y?  You can't test everything.

Or do you mean a test suite to which you pass a set of values
from which to select x, y, etc.?

Daniel
